intro: Tripleurospermum tempskyanum, commonly known as the Crimean tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Crimea and surrounding regions of southern Ukraine. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
